place.name: Arroyo Quemado Transect 6
place.geographicDescription: Transect begins slightly west of the river mouth. Sand (1-3cm deep) and bedrock substrate with low relief (0-0.5m). Depth is approximately 33 feet.
place.completeDescription: Transect begins slightly west of the river mouth and offshore (~60m) from T2-0m. Sand (1-3cm deep) and bedrock substrate with low relief (0-0.5m). Diopatra beds common. 0m bolt is located on a small rock ~0.5m above the surrounding substrate. 8m is a ½” rebar stake, all others are SS ¼” eyebolts with tubing. Rebar and bumpers are present at the 0 and 40m. Transect heading is 90 degrees.

verbatim.notesInfoReceived: 15-20 PTCA; 80% rock; no adult kelp; 3 juv kelp; PTL, DL, urchins, DIOR, and cryptic fish common.
0 PTCA; Silty sand; ~2 MAPY; Lots of DIOR; some DL
